channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump touts 'freedom zone' plan for Gaza in Qatar as ceasefire talks stall
item.description: President Trump is visiting Qatar and the U.A.E. after inking big weapons and tech deals in Saudi Arabia. So far, his trip hasn't seemed to push forward chances for a ceasefire in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is visiting Qatar and the U.A.E. after inking big weapons and tech deals in Saudi Arabia. So far, his trip hasn't seemed to push forward chances for a ceasefire in Gaza.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Perimenopause symptoms can be a drag. Here's when to seek treatment
item.description: From headaches and fatigue to hair loss and sleep troubles, the symptoms marking the transition to menopause can overlap with other conditions. Here's what to know and how to get help.
item.content:encoded: From headaches and fatigue to hair loss and sleep troubles, the symptoms marking the transition to menopause can overlap with other conditions. Here's what to know and how to get help.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Trump to meet South African president amid deteriorating relations
item.description: The visit comes as relations between the U.S. and South Africa are at their lowest since the end of apartheid. Trump has repeatedly claimed that "terrible things are happening" in South Africa,
item.content:encoded:
The visit comes as relations between the U.S. and South Africa are at their lowest since the end of apartheid. Trump has repeatedly claimed that "terrible things are happening" in South Africa,

(Image credit: Jerome Delay)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Birthright citizenship heads to court. And, more roadblocks to Trump's 'big' bill
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear historic arguments over birthright citizenship today. And, House Republicans are working to advance Trump's "big beautiful bill," but there is division over policies.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court will hear historic arguments over birthright citizenship today. And, House Republicans are working to advance Trump's "big beautiful bill," but there is division over policies.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The all-female free divers of Jeju Island have a 'superpower' in their genes
item.description: The all-female Korean Haenyeo divers show genetic adaptations to cold-water diving involving their blood pressure and cold tolerance. "It's like a superpower," says one of the researchers.
item.content:encoded:
The all-female Korean Haenyeo divers show genetic adaptations to cold-water diving involving their blood pressure and cold tolerance. "It's like a superpower," says one of the researchers.

(Image credit: SeongJoon Cho)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Dozens are killed in overnight airstrikes on southern Gaza city, hospital says
item.description: It was the second night of heavy bombing, after airstrikes Wednesday on northern and southern Gaza killed dozens of people, including almost two dozen children.
item.content:encoded:
It was the second night of heavy bombing, after airstrikes Wednesday on northern and southern Gaza killed dozens of people, including almost two dozen children.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Majority of Americans oppose ending birthright citizenship, NPR/Ipsos poll finds
item.description: As the Supreme Court takes up birthright citizenship, a new poll finds that less than a third of Americans want it to end. But other parts of the White House's immigration crackdown are more popular.
item.content:encoded:
As the Supreme Court takes up birthright citizenship, a new poll finds that less than a third of Americans want it to end. But other parts of the White House's immigration crackdown are more popular.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Under attack, public media makes its case to Congress and the courts
item.description: Nearly 200 officials from public radio stations across the country are descending on Capitol Hill to seek to convince lawmakers to maintain funding for public broadcasting despite President Trump's campaign against it.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly 200 officials from public radio stations across the country are descending on Capitol Hill to seek to convince lawmakers to maintain funding for public broadcasting despite President Trump's campaign against it.

(Image credit: STEFANI REYNOLDS/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Marine life's latest hotspot could be an underwater volcano primed to erupt off Oregon
item.description: A researcher monitoring Axial Seamount, 300 miles off the coast of Oregon, says the eruption is expected to happen before the year is over.
item.content:encoded:
A researcher monitoring Axial Seamount, 300 miles off the coast of Oregon, says the eruption is expected to happen before the year is over.

(Image credit: Susan Merle)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: A Texas abortion ban sponsor aims to clarify when doctors can do the procedure
item.description: Since abortion became almost entirely illegal in Texas in 2021, the state has seen a significant rise in the number of women who die in pregnancy or after giving birth. A new bill aims to change that.
item.content:encoded:
Since abortion became almost entirely illegal in Texas in 2021, the state has seen a significant rise in the number of women who die in pregnancy or after giving birth. A new bill aims to change that.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle
